items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at San Jose City College, Technology Center, T-415, 600 S. Bascom Avenue, San Jose, CA 95128
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at San Jose City College, Technology Center, T-415, 600 S. Bascom Avenue, San Jose, CA 95128

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access
items.item_text_raw: 2. Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

items.item_details:
A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the following Management Personnel Actions:
	 
	 
Temporary Change of Status
	 
Temporary Salary Increase.
The Dean of Enrollment Services for EVC will receive additional 5% for his expanded role overseeing the FasTrack and CalWORKS programs from 03/12/12 to 04/26/12. 
The Director of Student Life for EVC will receive additional 5% for his expanded role overseeing the EOPS and CARE programs from 03/12/12 to 04/26/12.
	 
Management Contract Renewal
	 
Two Year Contract for Evergreen Valley College.
The Dean of Social Science, Physical Education, Arts and Humanities for EVC is receiving a two year contract effective 07/01/12.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Management personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the following Classified Personnel Actions:
	 
1. Classification Changes
a. Position Eliminated
Elimination of Staff Accountant (7WINX0223C) in WIN/CalWORKS at San Jose City College effective 04/25/12.
	 
b. Position Established
Establishment of Accounting Technician (7WINX0226C) in WIN/CalWORKS at San Jose City College effective 04/25/12.
	 
2. Employment
a. New Hire
Employment of Instructional Support Assistant, Lab Lead (8LANG0235C) at Evergreen Valley College in Language Arts effective 04/09/12.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Classified Personnel Actions as submitted

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.
items.item_text: Hourly, Student Work & Volunteer Personnel Actions

items.item_details:
The proposed course has been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the All-College Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate.  The rigor of the approval process assures that the new course have substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that it fills a clear student need not being served by existing course findings.  The new course is:
	 
MUSIC 011B:  Musicianship
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the curriculum recommendation for the new course submitted by Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details: Presentation to the Board of Trustees by San Jose City College

Pursuant to Government Code Section 3547, the California School Employees Association, Chapter 363 presents their Reopener Proposal with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District for 2012-2013.  The California School Employees Association, Chapter 363 will provide the Articles to be negotiated for 2012-2013, during the board meeting.
